title.narrative: The Global Fund Malaria GUY-M-MOH on the Integrated Approach Towards Malaria Elimination in Foci 1A,1B and 1C in Guyana

description.narrative: The project aims to contribute to the National Malaria Strategic Plan to decrease the incidence of malaria by building capacity in vulnerable communities in region 1 to offer reliable, prompt diagnosis and treatment services. This initiative intends to reduce the transmission of malaria in 33 locations and establish systems for ongoing reporting and monitoring of service delivery. Two main outcomes with four interconnected outputs and activities have been identified. Outcome 1: A healthier population within communities vulnerable to malaria. Output 1: Vulnerable populations have greater access to RDT and antimalarial medicines. In partnership with the Ministry of Health, facilitate the training of 137 miners and loggers to provide prompt diagnosis and treatment to 4500 miners and loggers. Outcome 2: To reduce and interrupt malaria transmission through early diagnosis and timely and effective treatment. Outputs 2.1: MSD trained provide RDT and treatment. Mobilize miners and loggers as part of the malaria workforce. Output 2.2: Retrain MSD to consider the attrition rate in the mining camps. Mobilize and train new MSD to provide malaria RDT and treatment based on attrition rate. Output 2.3: M&E and supervisory visits conducted to improve malaria surveillance. Carry-out regular monitoring to follow-up with MSD.
